body:
I wanted to try it and got:

Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "C:\programy\Sublime3\Data\Packages\SublimeClang\sublimeclang.py", line 36, in <module>
    import Queue
ImportError: No module named 'Queue'

which seems weird to me as it's inside 'try' block so should rather run code in 'except' block...

I was trying 23ee17178bae9d18340b3033fb5a159e4958ee14 on Windows.

BTW. Is clang DLL no longer shipped with the plugin? Where am I supposed to get it from?
Dll's aren't in the repo, you can pull them from a [binary package](https://github.com/quarnster/SublimeClang/downloads).

If I workaround problem with importing (just leave the 'except' block), I get:

```
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "C:\programy\Sublime3\sublime_plugin.py", line 70, in reload_plugin
    m = importlib.import_module(modulename)
  File "X/importlib/__init__.py", line 88, in import_module
  File "<frozen importlib._bootstrap>", line 1577, in _gcd_import
  File "<frozen importlib._bootstrap>", line 1558, in _find_and_load
  File "<frozen importlib._bootstrap>", line 1525, in _find_and_load_unlocked
  File "<frozen importlib._bootstrap>", line 586, in _check_name_wrapper
  File "<frozen importlib._bootstrap>", line 1023, in load_module
  File "<frozen importlib._bootstrap>", line 1004, in load_module
  File "<frozen importlib._bootstrap>", line 562, in module_for_loader_wrapper
  File "<frozen importlib._bootstrap>", line 869, in _load_module
  File "<frozen importlib._bootstrap>", line 313, in _call_with_frames_removed
  File "C:\programy\Sublime3\Data\Packages\SublimeClang\sublimeclang.py", line 36, in <module>
    from .internals.clang import cindex
  File "C:\programy\Sublime3\Data\Packages\SublimeClang\internals\clang\cindex.py", line 118, in <module>
    lib = get_cindex_library()
  File "C:\programy\Sublime3\Data\Packages\SublimeClang\internals\clang\cindex.py", line 86, in get_cindex_library
    return cdll.LoadLibrary("libclang_x64.dll")
  File "X/ctypes/__init__.py", line 431, in LoadLibrary
  File "X/ctypes/__init__.py", line 353, in __init__
OSError: [WinError 126] The specified module could not be found
```

With libclang_x64.dll in the plugin's directory. I had to move it to the SublimeText's directory to make plugin work.

On ST3 startup, I got the following errors in console, btw:

    reloading plugin SublimeClang.common
    Traceback (most recent call last):
      File "/Applications/Sublime Text.app/Contents/MacOS/sublime_plugin.py", line 71, in reload_plugin
        m = importlib.import_module(modulename)
      File "X/importlib/__init__.py", line 88, in import_module
      File "<frozen importlib._bootstrap>", line 1577, in _gcd_import
      File "<frozen importlib._bootstrap>", line 1558, in _find_and_load
      File "<frozen importlib._bootstrap>", line 1522, in _find_and_load_unlocked
    ImportError: No module named 'SublimeClang.common'

    reloading plugin SublimeClang.sublimeclang
    Traceback (most recent call last):
      File "/Users/jjgod/Library/Application Support/Sublime Text 3/Packages/SublimeClang/sublimeclang.py", line 36, in <module>
        import Queue
    ImportError: No module named 'Queue'

    reloading plugin SublimeClang.translationunitcache
    Traceback (most recent call last):
      File "/Applications/Sublime Text.app/Contents/MacOS/sublime_plugin.py", line 71, in reload_plugin
        m = importlib.import_module(modulename)
      File "X/importlib/__init__.py", line 88, in import_module
      File "<frozen importlib._bootstrap>", line 1577, in _gcd_import
      File "<frozen importlib._bootstrap>", line 1558, in _find_and_load
      File "<frozen importlib._bootstrap>", line 1522, in _find_and_load_unlocked
    ImportError: No module named 'SublimeClang.translationunitcache'
Did you use the git version? The binary package isn't ready for ST3.

Yes, it is the git version, somehow I have to mess with install_name_tool myself to get libclang.dylib loaded, but these output is after I got rid of the loading problem and SublimeClang is working properly, but I wonder if there is a way to prevent such messages.
